channel.title: BBC News
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see https://www.bbc.co.uk/usingthebbc/terms-of-use/#15metadataandrssfeeds for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Gaza hospital says 24 people killed near aid site as witnesses blame IDF
item.description: Witnesses say Israeli troops opened fire as people were trying to get food. The IDF says there were no known injuries.

item.title: 'They were just kids': Mother mourns sons killed in Israeli strike while waiting for aid
item.description: Two of Iman al-Nouri's five sons were killed outside a clinic in Deir al-Balah on Thursday, while a third was seriously wounded.

item.title: Outrage builds over plan to force all Gazans to southern city
item.description: Critics denounce a plan by Israel's defence minister to relocate all Palestinians in Gaza to a small area in the south.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire talks on verge of collapse, Palestinian officials say
item.description: Senior Palestinian officials accuse Israel of deliberately stalling the negotiations in Qatar during the prime minister's US visit.

item.title: Israeli settlers kill Palestinians in West Bank attack, health ministry says
item.description: A US citizen was beaten to death and a Palestinian shot and killed when Israeli settlers attacked Sinjil, the Palestinian health ministry says.

item.title: Gaza's largest functioning hospital facing disaster, medics warn, as Israel widens offensive
item.description: Nasser hospital in Khan Younis has a critical shortage of fuel and had to stop admitting patients after Israeli tanks advanced nearby on Thursday.

item.title: Iran could recover some enriched uranium after US strikes, Israeli official says
item.description: The US has insisted that Iran's nuclear facilities were completely 'obliterated' during strikes in June.

item.title: Iranian activist says country threatening her with 'physical elimination'
item.description: Mohammadi was awarded the 2023 Nobel Peace Prize for work including tackling oppression of women in Iran.

item.title: Children queuing for supplements killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, hospital says
item.description: Eight children were among 15 people reportedly killed while queuing outside a clinic in the central town of Deir al-Balah.

item.title: Search for survivors after Houthis sink second Red Sea cargo ship in a week
item.description: At least three of the 25 people on board the Eternity C were killed after it was attacked by the Iran-backed group.

item.title: US sanctions UN expert Francesca Albanese, critic of Israel's Gaza offensive
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio linked the move to her support for the International Criminal Court (ICC).

item.title: Gaza truce talks reportedly stall despite second Netanyahu-Trump meeting
item.description: A Palestinian official says key sticking points at the indirect negotiations in Qatar include how aid will be distributed.

item.title: Son of couple held in Iran: 'They aren't spies, they're Mum and Dad'
item.description: Joe Bennett says he has not heard from his parents in six months after their arrest on spying charges.

item.title: Hamas used sexual violence as part of 'genocidal strategy', Israeli experts say
item.description: The Dinah Project, an all-women group, lays out "a legal blueprint for prosecuting these crimes", which Hamas has denied committing.

item.title: Israeli defence minister plans to move Gaza's population to camp in Rafah
item.description: Israel Katz tells Israeli media the so-called "humanitarian city" in Rafah will eventually house 2.1 million Palestinians.

item.title: Two crew killed in attack on cargo ship in Red Sea
item.description: The Liberian-flagged Eternity C, carrying 22 crew, is reported to be adrift and listing.

item.title: Trump upbeat on Gaza ceasefire talks despite lack of breakthrough
item.description: The US president said talk were going "very well", but a Palestinian source tells the BBC they have not made headway.

item.title: Yemen to execute Indian nurse on death row - can she be saved?
item.description: Campaigners say Nimisha Priya can still be saved if the victim's family accept blood money and pardon her.

item.title: Netanyahu visits US as Trump puts pressure to agree Gaza ceasefire deal
item.description: Israel's prime minister is under pressure from Donald Trump and people at home to agree a new ceasefire and hostage release deal.

item.title: Israel's strike on bustling Gaza cafe killed a Hamas operative - but dozens more people were killed
item.description: The attack raises more questions over whether Israel’s use of force is proportionate, as required by international law.

item.title: 'I don't know who to trust anymore': Druze worry about being left behind in post-war Syria
item.description: Recent attacks on the religious minority in Damascus have fuelled growing distrust towards the state.

item.title: Tehran is coming back to life, but its residents are deeply shaken
item.description: As Iran's capital resumes its old rhythms, the BBC's Lyse Doucet meets locals who wonder if peace will last.

item.title: A month into Gaza's new aid system - killings, gunfire and chaos are routine
item.description: A month into the resumption of aid distribution in Gaza there have been repeated reports of killings, with a BBC Verify analysis of dozens of videos showing chaos and panic as people head to get aid.

item.title: Iran carries out wave of arrests and executions in wake of Israel conflict
item.description: Iranian authorities have carried out arrests and executions of people suspected of links to Israeli intelligence agencies.

item.title: EU's 27 countries struggle to find a united voice on Gaza
item.description: EU foreign policy decisions have to be unanimous, so one objection can block the EU from taking action.

item.title: When Iran's supreme leader emerges from hiding he will find a very different nation
item.description: The war has left the country significantly weakened - and Ayatollah Ali Khamenei a diminished leader

item.title: Make Iran Great Again? 'Tehrangeles' community in LA reflects on US strikes
item.description: The US bombing of Iran's nuclear sites has stirred strong feelings in the Iranian community of Los Angeles.

item.title: What we know about the Iran-Israel ceasefire
item.description: Donald Trump accuses both sides of breaking the ceasefire and urges them to "calm down".

item.title: 'We are exhausted' - how Iranians are feeling after fragile ceasefire
item.description: The war has stirred within Iranians a mix of fear, despair and - among some - flickers of hope.

item.title: 'We thought it was the end': Israeli town reels after deadly strike
item.description: Four people were killed by an Iranian missile strike in Beersheba just before a ceasefire came into effect.

item.title: Strait of Hormuz: What happens if Iran shuts global oil corridor?
item.description: Iran's threat to block the world's most vital oil transit point has raised fears of major global economic consequences.

item.title: Former Mossad official details how Israel eliminated Iran's military elite
item.description: The former deputy chief of the Israeli intelligence explains how technology and innovation played a key role for Israel in the 12-day conflict.

item.title: 'Iran pulses with anger and even deeper grief', says BBC's Lyse Doucet
item.description: Lyse Doucet witnesses a mass state funeral for prominent figures killed in the recent conflict with Israel.

item.title: BBC inside Iran state TV building hit by Israeli missile strike
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from the ruins of an Iranian state TV building hit during the conflict with Israel.

item.title: Watch: BBC's Lyse Doucet reports from Iran on the ceasefire with Israel
item.description: Lyse Doucet reports from the streets of Tehran, where she says things are staring to return to normal.

item.title: Trump in angry outburst aimed at Israel and Iran
item.description: The US president expressed his frustration at the conduct of the two nations.

item.title: 'It took a direct hit' - BBC at scene of Beersheba missile strike
item.description: At least four people were killed when an Iranian missile hit a residential building, Israeli officials say.
